item.title: 8 Best Sci-Fi Horror Games
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Sci-fi horror games delve into themes of hubris and humanity, immersing players in futuristic technology and terrifying encounters.
  • Psychological horror in games like I Have No Mouth And I Must Scream creates intense, hopeless atmospheres for players to navigate.
  • Sci-fi horror games like Alien Isolation and Dead Space blend immersive storytelling, advanced technology, and atmospheric dread.

Horror and sci-fi are a match made in heaven or, more appropriately, hell. For as much as sci-fi is about exploring, it is specifically about exploring the unknown, something the horror genre thrives on. The medium of video games only serves to enhance this, putting the player firmly in the driver's seat and letting them explore each game at their own pace, often putting the horrors right in front of them.

The longer length of video games means that themes can be explored more thoroughly and thoughtfully—themes such as hubris, humanity, and playing god, key staples shared by both genres. Another additional benefit is that players can directly interact with the futuristic technology in the games, creating a deep sense of immersion; making the upcoming scares all the more terrifying.

8 Prey (2017)

Never Has A Mug Been So Untrustworthy.

Another brilliant immersive sim from Arkane (the studio behind Dishonored ), Prey involves Morgan Yu exploring the space station Talos I during an attack by an alien force known as the Typhoon. Players familiar with the genre will be right at home, looking for door codes and solving environmental puzzles in creative and inventive ways. The mysterious Typhoon will naturally stalk the player and attack them with various powers and those not paying full attention will be caught unawares.

One of Prey’s central mechanics allows Morgan to be upgraded with various skills, including those of the Typhoon. Players can beat the aliens at their own game, however, they may risk being listed as a threat by the station's security measures. It also won't protect them from mimics, which makes the player question every object they come across, as an unnoticed mug may suddenly jump out and attack them.

7 I Have No Mouth And I Must Scream

There Is Not A Bigger Hater Than AM

Based on the short story of the same name, I Have No Mouth And I Must Scream is a point-and-click horror game where five protagonists, the last humans on Earth, are forced to face grueling, personalized trials after being tortured for 109 years. This is orchestrated by AM, a god-like sentient supercomputer, who does this because he hates humanity.

The player has to navigate each character through each scenario where they solve classic point-and-click puzzles. The kicker is that it is completely possible, and easy, to fail; the game is difficult without any sort of walkthrough. While this sounds frustrating, it only adds to the pure horror of hopelessness, making it a sci-fi horror classic. The game was even co-authored by the original writer, Harlan Ellison, who expanded on his original story. He also lent his voice to AM, creating a meta-context in the narrative where the player is effectively going up against the god of the story.

6 Lethal Company

Mechanical Keyboard Users Beware

Horror and comedy have often been said to be two sides of the same coin and nothing proves this more than Lethal Company . It’s hilarious to watch a team member get eaten by an eyeless dog because they breathed too hard into their microphones by accident. It is significantly less funny when it happens to the player.

Players will work in a team to scour various moons for scrap to sell whilst avoiding various monsters including, but not limited to, the stealthy Braken, the Weeping Angel-esque Coil Heads, and pools of sentient slime. If players do not meet a quota before a deadline lest they face severe consequences from the company…

5 System Shock 2

Showdown With SHODAN

While the recent remake of the first game made a very archaic game much easier to play, System Shock 2 is a much more refined and more important video game going on to inspire BioShock and Prey plus various other immersive sims. Going back and playing the game shows off mechanics that would become a staple in the genre, such as superpowers in the form of psi powers, excellent open-level design, and RPG leveling.

Its horror comes from the eeriness of the empty space station where no one else seems to be alive save for many of the abominations that have to be fought, and SHODAN's return speech is just as memorable all these years later.

4 Alien Isolation

It May Be Called Isolation, But Ripley Isn’t Alone...

In 1979, the film, Alien cemented itself as one of the most tense and gorgeous looking sci-fi films of all time, so it's only natural that Alien: Isolation would do the same but in the medium of video games. Putting them in the shoes of Amanda Ripley, players will search the Sevastopol Space Station for Ellen Ripley’s flight recording. Aesthetically, the game looks just like movies, having that iconic retro-futuristic theme that feels cold and corporate, creating a sense of dread.

Players will definitely feel vulnerable exploring Sevastopol with little more than the franchise's iconic motion tracker, beeping faster and faster, warning them of their imminent demise at the hands of the titular alien, or it could just be another human. Either way, careful consideration must be taken as even the smallest sound can be detected, leading to a quick death if players don’t react appropriately. To make matters worse, the Xenomorph learns as the game progresses, keeping its bag of tricks fresh.

3 Stasis: Bone Totem

There Is A Reason The Ocean Is Unexplored

  • Released : May 31, 2023
  • Developer : Brotherhood Games
  • Platforms : PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, Nintendo Switch

Trading the first game’s space setting for an ocean one, the sequel to Stasis , Stasis: Bone Totem goes for a slower-paced point-and-click experience rather than full-on combat like some of its contemporaries. Despite this, it's still very macabre, perhaps even more so, many of the challenging puzzles have a gruesome twist, sometimes involving investigating cadavers or potentially killing the player if they fail severely.

In terms of narrative, two salvagers, Charlie and Mac, and their late daughter’s seemingly sentient super-toy, Mosses, come across an abandoned oil rig ripe for salvaging, but they soon discover some things were better left submerged as they discover the horrifying events that transpired while having their family ties tested.

2 Signalis

Seeking Answers When There Are Only Questions

An android-like being known as a replika, called Ester has just woken up and is forced to fight her corrupted, monstrous, brethren. Signalis ’ gameplay is very similar to that of a classic Resident Evil game with backtracking, safe rooms, and ammo management, not to mention various brain-scratching puzzles.

What makes it so compelling is its presentation(intentionally similar to classic 3D survival horror from the 5th console generation) and its story. A story that explores themes of dreams, the self, and identity, all wrapped in Lovecraftian-style horror. It’s classic sci-fi through and through.

1 Dead Space (2023)

No Job Is Worth This

If there was an award for “Worst Day At Work”, engineer Isaac Clark would win it by a mile. The protagonist of Dead Space goes through some truly awful stuff on the USG Ishimura, a mining vessel during an emergency mission. Players will have to navigate the ship's various nooks and crannies, fighting off necromorphs using various engineering tools at their disposal, all in the hopes of finding a way to escape the horrors of the ship.

What makes Dead Space stand out as a sci-fi horror is the fact that the world the characters inhabit feels truly natural and fleshed out. Even without the monsters, it's still exciting to see the various pieces of future tech, such as the kinetic module or the engineering suits Issac dons throughout the game. This technology even plays into the user interface as it is all diegetic, creating a great sense of immersion. The 2023 remake only serves to improve the overall experience offering better zero-gravity gameplay and better audio among other things.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Today's Event Schedule & Best Strategy (December 10, 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Monopoly GO Events Schedule for December 10, 2024
  • Best Monopoly GO Strategy For December 10, 2024

Following the conclusion of the Holiday Treasures dig event, Monopoly GO players can now enjoy their favorite Peg-E Prize Drop minigame. It’s the first Prize Drop since the new album season started and is surely packed with exciting prizes.

While luck plays a huge role in Peg-E Prize Drop, the right strategy can make all the difference when it comes to winning big. This guide covers everything you need to know about the Monopoly GO events planned for December 10, 2024, and includes the best strategy to maximize your rewards in Peg E Prize Drop today.

Monopoly GO Events Schedule for December 10, 2024

As usual, Monopoly GO has a full lineup of events planned for December 10, 2024. Check out the sections below for a breakdown of today’s event schedule.

Solo Event

Here’s the solo event for today in Monopoly GO :

Here’s a list of all the flash boosters you can enjoy in Monopoly GO today:

Best Monopoly GO Strategy For December 10, 2024

With the Peg-E Prize Drop minigame in full swing, your focus should be on collecting as many Peg-E tokens as possible from the top and sidebar events. Remember to complete your daily Quick Wins in Monopoly GO to get more Peg-E tokens and increase your chances of winning big prizes.

This week’s Quick Wins will reward you with a Holiday Chest , instead of the Purple Sticker Pack. Make sure you don’t miss any tasks or you will not be able to claim the Holiday Chest.

Use the mid-day High Roller to your advantage. This flash booster is perfect if you want to progress through the top and side events quickly. You can also use the cash earned from these events along with the Free Parking (Cash) and Mega Heist events to build during the Board Rush.

item.title: Marvel Rivals: How To Play Winter Soldier
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Winter Soldier Abilities Overview
  • How To Play Winter Soldier In Marvel Rivals
  • How To Counter Winter Soldier In Marvel Rivals
  • Beast Team Composition For Winter Soldier In Marvel Rivals

Winter Soldier is one of the strongest Duelists in Marvel Rivals , with an aggressive chasing and grappling kit that impairs the movement of his foes and a powerful execution ability that can be spammed to wipe out an entire team. He is moderately difficult to master but fun to play, and it feels rewarding when getting the hang of his kit.

If players want to get the best out of this Hybrid Duelist, they should take a look at this guide, as it has a lot of great info. It will go through an overview of all Winter Soldier's abilities, how to play him, how to counter him, and the best team composition to make the most out of his abilities.

Winter Soldier Abilities Overview

  • Roterstern - Primary Attack: Winter Soldier aims and shoots his faithful revolver, dealing great damage at moderate range (40 m). Can do precision damage (headshots) and needs to reload every three shots. But, thanks to its passive, each time Winter Soldier uses a skill, this will refill the magazine automatically.
  • Kraken Impact - Ultimate Attack: Winter Soldier jumps into the air and smashes the ground, dealing damage in an AoE and marking all targets with "Culling," which makes them be automatically executed upon reaching 20% Health. Killing Marked enemies resets Kraken Impact for a re-cast and can be spammed as long as Winter Soldier kills marked enemies. Enemies that are at 20% or lower will be immediately executed by the initial impact.
  • Trooper's Fist - Winter Soldier dashes in the aiming direction and pushes back the enemies, then propels them into the air for a brief instant, making them vulnerable to all attacks.
  • Tainted Voltage - Shoots an orb of electricity from his fist that slows down foes, making them vulnerable to combos. It also makes flying targets (such as Iron Man and Storm) fall to the ground.
  • Bionic Hook - Fires a Grappling Hook that penetrates rivals, grabbing enemies in a straight line and pulling them toward Winter Soldier. Enemies hiding behind their allies are also reeled in.
  • Ceaseless Charge - Passive: Each time Winter Soldier uses an ability, his bionic arm automatically loads Roterstern and grants bonus Health to Winter Soldier.
  • Infinite Grit - Team-Up Passive: When Rocket Raccoon is in the same team, he can throw a power up station that makes Winter Soldier's Roterstern increase its fire rate and have infinite ammo. Getting out of the AoE provided by this support skill will cease the effect after 0.5 seconds.

Winter Soldier is a combo-based Duelist that shifts from mid-range attacks to powerful chasing and crowd-control abilities in a matter of seconds. Any Winter Soldier that is left unattended for long can wipe out an entire team, and with his powerful execution ultimate ( Kraken Impact ), he can basically chain combos and kill enemies endlessly. If the team is struggling to deal with pesky foes like Scarlet Witch, there's no better chaser than him.

He is a great initiator, but a lousy brawler, so having him take the lead during battle is not a good idea. Instead, take advantage of his passive and combo ranged attacks with abilities to perform masterful takedowns and pin down priority targets such as Cloak & Dagger, Spider-Man, Black Widow, Hawkeye, Jeff The Land Shark, and Iron Fist.

Winter Soldier Basic Combos

His basic combo consists of Two Shots + Tainted Voltage + Trooper's Fist + Shot x2. Alternatively, players can target more than one enemy by using the following combo: Shot x2 + Bionic Hook + Shot x2 + Tainted Voltage. Another alternative is to chain the following attacks: Shot + Trooper's Fist, Shot x3 + Tainted Voltage + Shoot + Bionic Hook + Shoot x2.

Winter Soldier Ultimate Combo

When his Ultimate ability is ready, Winter Soldier can engage using Trooper's Fist, then Kraken Impact + Shoot + Tainted Voltage + Kraken Impact + Shoot + Kraken Impact. This devastating combo can wipe out an entire team, and players can chain it endlessly since Kraken Fist resets after executing a Rival.

Take advantage of Winter Soldier's powerful crowd control skills and stick with the team to share the glory . Leading the team to victory is quite rewarding, more so if he ends up wiping an entire team by landing a timely Kraken Impact. Remember that this hero's crowd control can greatly benefit other characters that have a hard time landing a precise shot, like Black Widow and Hawkeye.

How To Play Winter Soldier In Marvel Rivals

Winter Soldier is a side-initiator, flanker, and chaser , so naturally, he is going to be playing near the frontlines next to Melee Duelists and Vanguards. His kit is filled with lots of crowd control and creates incredible synergies with many heroes like Punisher, Captain America, Storm, Black Widow, Hawkeye, Groot, Jeff, Loki, and Thor.

Having Winter Soldier playing as a mid-range marksman is useful for certain tactics and specific team goals like escorting the payload in Convoy or defending an area in Domination, but his kit is more optimized to grab, chase, and destroy rivals . So, with this in mind, let's analyze how to play Winter Soldier in each of the game modes of Marvel Rivals.

Convoy Mode Winter Soldier Tips

During Defense , Winter Soldier plays a fundamental role that is flanking opponents, chasing down Strategists (Healers), and destroying annoying targets such as Jeff The Land Shark (or the most annoying of them all: Luna Snow). Have Winter Soldier tailgate opponents that are trying to flank the team, and associate with fast Duelists like Spider-Man, Iron Fist, or Hawkeye to pin down flying opponents like Storm, Iron Man, and Moon Knight (who doesn't fly but falls with style — still annoying). Remember to combo each ability with basic attacks for maximum output damage, and use that grappling hook to pick up fleeing targets.

During Offense , always prioritize healers first, then ranged Duelists. Winter Soldier will be an easy target if he is cornered by many rivals, so the best approach here is to use Trooper's Fist to either pick up Healing stations (by dashing toward them) or make Winter Soldier retreat to a more secure area. Dash and grab isolated targets, or stick near the Strategists to prevent melee duelists from overwhelming them, but keep an eye out for Iron Fist and Wolverine as they're Winter Soldier's natural counters. If Winter Soldier is near Punisher and Rocket Raccoon, he will become nearly unstoppable, so having these three in a team is a recipe for a win.

Domination Mode Winter Soldier Tips

Domination basically consists of taking zones, moving from one zone to the next and retaining them until they reach 100% completion. The team that captures two zones is the winner, and Winter Soldier is the key to a fast victory. By pinning down opponents, or isolating squishier targets like Black Widow, Hawkeye, or the agile Psylocke, this hero proves that he has what it needs to be a great team player. Having Winter Soldier outflanking foes, harassing their healers and supports, and creating mayhem by unleashing the Kraken Impact (pun intended) at the right time can shift the balance toward victory in a finger snap.

Just remember not to overextend attacks or become isolated. Winter Soldier might be equipped with a self-heal passive ( Infinite Grit), but that doesn't make him immortal, so knowing when to retreat and search for aid is the best approach. Flee from Iron Fist, Wolverine, and Venom, because they can totally overwhelm Winter Soldier in a matter of seconds.

Winter Soldier can use abilities like Trooper's Fist to "Negate Healing." Simply dash to intercept enemies that are looking for Health stations or pull them off their route with Bionic Hook, then punish them with a good combo. Sometimes, camping in the sidelines waiting for weakened enemies to go back and heal can be rewarding.

Convergence Mode Winter Soldier Tips

During Defense , Winter Soldier doesn't benefit too much from over preparation; he is more of a spontaneous, combo-based assault hero (all in one) and will lead the charge when needed — or rotate when there's a problem in the backline. Most of the time, he's a great defense for the back line, since enemies prefer to target healers first for obvious reasons. So, in Defense Mode, make sure to rotate often between the mid line (behind the Vanguards) and the backline (next to Strategists) and protect the latter from being isolated by the likes of Spider-Man, Iron Fist, Psylocke, Cloak & Dagger, or Namor.

During Offense , remain next to the frontline, supporting melee duelists to make their foes easier targets by combing Trooper's Fist, Tainted Voltage, and Bionic Hook. Remember that Tainted Voltage also causes flying enemies to fall (Storm, Iron Man, Moon Knight, and Spider-Man, for example), and a well placed skillshot can make the difference and turn the tides when most needed. Finally, Kraken Impact is a great way to execute targets; follow the team and activate when someone drops near 20% HP, this will create a combo sequence that can be infinitely chained and lead the team to victory.

How To Counter Winter Soldier In Marvel Rivals

Winter Soldier can be annoying, but he is not invulnerable, nor a difficult target to overwhelm. The most basic strategy to counter him in Marvel Rivals is to flank him , since his frontal assault combo is quite powerful. Players need to wait until its on cooldown before engaging him by two sides. Overwhelming him from a distance with ranged duelists like Punisher, or with mid-range mobile Duelists like Star-Lord is a bad idea, since Winter Soldier can easily outmaneuver and make them bleed in a matter of seconds.

Sending something bulkier like Venom to play with him while Black Widow or Hawkeye takes him down from afar is a better strategy. But, in case players are wondering how to deal with him in each situation, here's an overview of how to counter Winter Soldier in each of Marvel Rivals' modes.

Convoy Mode (Counter Winter Soldier)

During Defense , Winter Soldier will most likely go after healers, so Strategists like Rocket Raccoon, Mantis, Adam Warlock, and Cloak & Dagger are his priority targets. Stick close to them to negate a gank, and prevent squishier Fronline Duelists like Psylocke and Captain America from overextending, since they will be easily overwhelmed by Winter Soldier's CC combo assault.

During Offense , severing the lifeline between Winter Soldier and his support is the way to go here. This Duelist doesn't have too much mitigation, but he's resilient and has an annoying passive that makes him difficult to kill if he is constantly chaining combos. Better wait until he spends all his abilities — and always attack from both sides at the same time; that way, he cannot grab all the team with his bionic arm and send them back to respawn.

Domination Mode (Counter Winter Soldier)

Here is where Winter Soldier shines the most. His ability to chase, rotate, assassinate, and basically destroy the whole team is concerning. When he has Kraken Impact ready, simply flee, as engaging him is like courting death. Plus, he can execute and re-cast his ultimate endlessly, so a misstep can become a team wipe. Instead, try to use as much crowd control on him as possible, and call out for ranged Duelists (especially Black Widow) when he is pinned down.

If the team sends Captain America to face him, they're up for a surprise, since Winter Soldier's kit overwhelms the Best Avenger in a matter of seconds. Instead, use Venom, Hulk, or Thor to smash him against a wall and blast him with everything in the arsenal.

Convergence Mode (Counter Winter Soldier)

During Defense , Winter Soldier will be easy to spot, since in this game mode, players prefer to stick to the frontline and initiate the assault on the objective. All the melee Duelists associated with him will benefit from his powerful crowd control kit, so isolate him and then destroy the rest of the team. Entertaining him for too long or chasing him are bad ideas, since there's a chance he is kiting, or using his Trooper's Fist to negate healing (dashing over), so if he starts doing this, try to sideline him with a powerful melee Duelist like Iron FIst.

During Offense , better be prepared for anything, since Winter Soldier will become absolutely annoying. He will rotate, cover his Strategists, and remain associated with Rocket Raccoon and Punisher for a powerful combo. If they're together, it spells trouble, so it's time for a counter strategy. Using Magneto or Penni Parker, lead the frontal assault and make them concentrate fire on these targets, while sharpshooters like Black Widow or Hawkeye kill Rocket or Punisher. Once one is down, it's time for payback.

Remember that Rocket Raccoon's B.R.B. beacon and other deployable can (and must) be destroyed.

Beast Team Composition For Winter Soldier In Marvel Rivals

The best team composition to play with Winter Soldier in Marvel Rivals has Rocket Raccoon and Punisher working together with this former Hydra Assassin. Rocket's deployable abilities can buff both Punisher and Winter Soldier at the same time, empowering their attack, making them shoot faster, and providing infinite ammo. When combining this with Winter Soldier's powerful CC and Punisher's own deployable, the trio becomes a true menace.

To make this even more powerful, having Groot and Jeff the Land Shark in the team, and a healer like Mantis will surely cause a powerful synergy, since Rocket can climb on Groot's shoulders and become nearly untargetable, while Jeff protects Mantis from Duelists. Together, these heroes can win battles like crazy, especially when taking over or defending objective areas.

item.title: UFL: How to Play Online with Friends
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Play UFL Online with Friends
    • How to Create a Private Lobby in UFL

In UFL , players can choose from various modes, including the fan-favorite online Ranked competitive to showcase their skills or jump into the Casual mode to simply enjoy the world's most popular sport. However, many players are eager to experience the game alongside friends.

Whether it’s for a friendly in-house competition or just a fun way to pass the time, playing football games with friends has been a long-standing tradition across eras and video games. Strikerz Inc's game continues this legacy, making it easy for players to enjoy themselves with others. Here’s how to play UFL with your friends and make the most of the experience.

How to Play UFL Online with Friends

To play online with friends in UFL , simply select Casual mode . From there, you can either host a match by creating a lobby and sharing a unique code with your friends or join a friend’s match by entering their code.

Additionally, if you’re playing with friends in person and want to compete against others online , you can connect extra controllers through the menu , allowing everyone to participate in the match together. This feature makes it easy to expand the pool of players and enjoy a fun, competitive experience.

The unique generated code system for creating custom lobbies is a key feature that ensures your matches remain exclusive to your group. Only those with the code can join, giving you the peace of mind that the game will be just between you and your selected opponents.

Playing with friends in UFL offers a distinctive experience compared to traditional Ranked or Casual matches against online opponents. With friends, you can communicate during the game using voice chat, place friendly wagers, and create memorable competitions that often result in leaderboards that no one will ever forget, especially if you’re not the one on top.

How to Create a Private Lobby in UFL

To set up a private match in UFL and play with your friends, follow these steps:

  1. Launch the UFL app.
  2. Navigate to the Play Online menu and select the Casual section.
  3. Choose the Host option.
  4. Press the X button on PlayStation or the A button on Xbox to create a lobby.
  5. Share the unique code displayed at the top of the screen with your friends. ( Anyone with this code can join, so only share it with those you want to play against .)
  6. Once your friend joins the lobby, start the match and enjoy the game.

item.title: Stalker 2: Answers Come at a Price Walkthrough
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Start Answers Come at a Price Quest in Stalker 2
  • How to Enter The Old Factory
  • How to Find The Underground Lab
  • How to Get Evidence of Nestor’s Location

In Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl , your choices can make all the difference when it comes to shaping the narrative. This is made clear when you reach the Answers Come At A Price story quest. Depending on which route you took in the previous “Behind Seven Seals” mission, you’ll have entirely different objectives in the Answers Come At A Price quest.

The Answers Come At A Price mission is where Stalker 2 truly opens up. This story quest takes you to a new region, Garbage , situated north of the Lesser Zone. This guide covers a detailed walkthrough of the Answers Come At A Price quest to help you find Nestor and solve the mystery of your missing Scanner.

This walkthrough covers your mission objectives after taking the Northern Checkpoint - Spark Route.

How To Start Answers Come at a Price Quest in Stalker 2

If you chose to give the Ward Sensors to Richter during the "Behind Seven Seals" quest, your path through "Answers Come at a Price" will take you through the northern checkpoint to the Garbage region. Here, you’ll meet Star , the leader of the group Spark, at the Detention Center.

Star reveals that Nestor has taken refuge in the basement of a nearby factory . However, the factory is now under Ward control, and you’ll need to be careful if you want more information on Nestor. Star also informs you that a few of his men are trapped inside the factory. He’ll request you to rescue his men, triggering a side mission called "The Road to Salvation” in Stalker 2 . Completing this side quest rewards you with the PSZ-7 Military Body Armor, so don’t skip it.

How to Enter The Old Factory

There are two different ways you can enter the old factory in Garbage:

  1. Fight your way through the guards, taking down every soldier in your path. This approach is more direct but will cost you valuable ammo and medical supplies in Stalker 2 .
  2. Opt for a quieter route and slip past the guards undetected. The stealth route may take longer, but it’s safer and more efficient. Make sure to save your progress frequently when taking this path.

If you’re taking the stealth route, start by heading to the back of the facility. Look for a small hole in the wall on the southwest corner of the factory. Crouch and squeeze through it, and you’ll spot another hole in the building on the left.

Enter through the hole, turn left, and quickly go down the stairs before the guards above spot you. Carefully turn around the corner and use your silenced pistol or knife to eliminate the nearby guards without raising an alarm. Now that you’re inside the factory, the next objective is to find the lab.

How to Find The Underground Lab

After taking out the Ward Soldiers, head down the hallway and take the stairs leading to the basement. This will lead you to the door with a keypad on the side. Enter the code 2605 to gain access. Once you unlock the door, you’ll find more stairs leading to the lower floors.

Take the stairs down to the lowest level of the Laboratory. You’ll see one of Star’s men lying dead on the ground. Be careful as you navigate the area, as the lab is plagued by an Electrical Field Anomaly and inhabited by a dangerous Bloodsucker. After eliminating the threat, search the room for a Tape Recorder on a nearby table.

Explore the lab further to find the Product 81 Specifications , an item you can hand over to Star as part of The Road To Salvation side mission.

How to Get Evidence of Nestor’s Location

The recording begins to play automatically, revealing a conversation between Nestor and an associate named Diode. He mentions being at a settlement called Slag Heap. While Nestor's location remains unknown, you now have a promising lead: Diode .

As the recording ends, you receive a radio transmission from a mysterious man identified only as "Unknown" in the subtitles. He’s an ally of the Sparksters and thinks you’re one of them. During the conversation, you’ll have two dialogue options to choose from, but your choice doesn’t affect the outcome—Unknown will help you regardless.

He provides you with a code for a locked door at the top of the stairs. Head upstairs and use the code 2603 to unlock it. Progress through the factory until you reach a white door that triggers a cutscene with Unknown. Once the cutscene ends, the Answers Come At A Price quest will be completed and the next main mission, The Price Goes Up, will begin.
